intro: Dimerostemma annuum, commonly known as the annual dimerostemma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central corolla. Dimerostemma annuum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its dispersal in arid environments.
